message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine provides the longest duration of anesthesia, up to 8 hours, compared to the other options. Epinephrine helps to prolong the anesthetic effect by vasoconstriction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine is the best option for a longer duration of anesthesia for laceration repair because epinephrine constricts blood vessels, reducing systemic absorption and therefore prolonging the duration of anesthesia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine is a long-acting local anesthetic but adding epinephrine to it will increase its duration to up to 8 hours. Lidocaine is a short-acting local anesthetic and it is not recommended for longer procedures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine is a longer-lasting local anesthetic compared to lidocaine with epinephrine, making it the best option for offering longer anesthesia for laceration repair.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine offers more prolonged anesthesia than lidocaine with epinephrine due to the slower diffusion and metabolism of bupivacaine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine will offer the longest anesthesia for laceration repair as the epinephrine causes vasoconstriction, reducing blood flow to the area and prolonging the anesthetic effect of bupivacaine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, bupivacaine with epinephrine is known for its long-lasting anesthesia effects due to the vasoconstriction caused by epinephrine, which slows the absorption of the medication. This makes it the best option for the longest anesthesia for laceration repair.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine will offer the longest anesthesia for the laceration repair due to the vasoconstrictive effects of epinephrine, which decreases blood flow to the injection site, prolonging the anesthetic effect of bupivacaine. Lidocaine alone or with epinephrine has a shorter duration of action.

We refer to WebMD and other medical literature for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine offers longer anesthesia than the other options because the epinephrine constricts the blood vessels in the area, slowing the absorption of the medication and prolonging its effects. This allows for more effective pain management during the laceration repair.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupivacaine with epinephrine offers the longest anesthesia for the laceration repair as the addition of epinephrine causes local vasoconstriction, reducing blood flow and delaying drug absorption, prolonging its effect. Lidocaine and bupivacaine without epinephrine have shorter durations of action.
